Posts.Content: lehelter wrote: Can reduction in range of motion of shoulders be early warning signs of lymphedema in high risk patients? In other words, when a patient does routine stretching exercises after surgery but feels that the range of motion (how far the shoulder would move) has decreased, do the chances of developing lymphedema go up?
